Construct AAGI Colour Scales for ggplot2

Source: R/aagi_ggplot2_scales.R
scale_colour_aagi.Rd

Uses AAGI colours to create colour scales suitable for use in ggplot2 objects.

Usage

scale_colour_aagi(palette = "colourful", discrete = TRUE, reverse = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

palette

Character string, one of:

  • "primary",

  • "secondary",

  • "colourful" (default),

  • "full",

  • "bright", or

  • "bluegreen".

discrete

Boolean argument indicating whether colour aesthetic is discrete, e.g., a factor (TRUE) or continuous, e.g., numeric (FALSE).

reverse

Boolean argument indicating whether the palette should be reversed, i.e., light to dark. Defaults to FALSE.

...

Additional arguments passed to discrete_scale() or ggplot2::scale_colour_gradientn, used respectively when discrete is TRUE.

See also

aagi_palettes scale_fill_aagi
